We are sorry to hear that the Speedball Mid-Fire Blue Tiger's Eye glaze did not come out as expected on your vase. It is recommended to apply three liberal coats of the Blue Tiger's Eye and fire to Cone 5-6 without any holds. When applied thinner, this glaze does appear more green than blue with the associated breaks of brown. We encourage you to try the glaze again by applying a heavier coat each time you add a layer. We also have a PDF available in our Resources Tab that provides additional tips for applying this glaze. We hope this assists you going forward, and we thank you for your review.

ceramic_reviews.product: Mayco Ceramic Glaze Design Liners and Set
ceramic_reviews.review_desc: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with this product. Mayco's Designer Liners are similar to a translucent underglaze and are best used under non-moving transparent or semi-transparent glazes. They are formulated to mature at cone 06/05 and do work on top of a low-fire, non-moving glaze for design work. Most will maintain their color at higher temperatures, and they're tested for mid-range results, but any time you're combining different products and different brands, especially if you're firing hotter as you would be with Celadons, it's important to fire test tiles to determine what the outcome will be before applying to finished ware. If we can offer further assistance, just call 1-800-933-2542 (8am-5:30pm CST M-F) or email info@dickblick.com.

Even on a smooth surface it gives interesting variations and behaves similarly to a real Shino, although slightly more cinnamon in color than expected. Even though matte, it gave a slight sheen which I found attractive. I had trouble getting much cream to show up, except for on a small horizontal area with incised design. The reviewers who say it is "unpredictable" maybe don't understand the concept of a Shino glaze. The unpredictability is the virtue. For now, with my small scale and small pieces, I will happily continue using this glaze, and probably explore the other colors of this line.

I've been using the Blick brand ceramic glazes for a few years now and I LOVE them! So I thought I would try their new clear glaze... Well, I LOVE it and it works perfectly for what I needed it for. All of the Blick glazes work just as well as the more expensive "name brand" glazes and save me a LOT of money! #sweepstakes

Applies and dries a pale mint green, fires clear. I applied two layers of this glaze (drying in between) to my sgraffito work and fired at 5-6 (mid range, because that is all my studio offered) and it did great! There was no blistering, even over the graffito-ed underglaze which sometimes causes trouble with other glazes

This is a nice low-fire glossy clear glaze, especially for the price! I brushed on 2 coats over an orange underglaze and fired to cone 06. The glaze applied nice and consistently in a light green color, which allows you to easily see where you've glazed - some clears dry so light it is difficult to see on light clay bodies, but not this one! The glaze did craze on my clay (which was to be expected, as I only had mid-range clay on hand). I did fire a test tile to cone 6 - the glaze blistered, as I inferred it would from the notes on the bottle. All in all, this clear is a great option for low-fire! Blick provided product for free to try and review.
Works well at cone 6 over most glazes

The only good thing I can say about this glaze is that it goes on evenly. The results are nothing like the description. I used it to highlight the rim and add a few streaks. It fired a hazy white, looking like a film.
Easy to work with excellent results
These matte glazes are luscious. Applying them is almost as satisfying as the perfect result. I'm sincerely hoping Blick will make more colors.
Fired to cone 05 on a speckled clay body, vibrant color with 2-3 layers of glaze. Would absolutely recommend!

ceramic_reviews.review_title: great at low fire and mid range!
ceramic_reviews.review_desc: both the black and white are great at 06 and 6. would definitely use three coats! i applied it on greenware and bisqueware and saw good results with both. definitely use at least three coats, came out streaky on one that i didn't. honestly don't know if i love the smooth matte of the low fire or the glossy effect that happens at cone six but will definitely be using these regularly.

I received this glaze for free to test it out and leave my honest thoughts. I am happily surprised with the results I'm getting so far! I wanted to test it out on some wild clay that fires to 04. I got a smooth, pinhole free surface. I applied 3 thin coats to the inside of this vessel only, at leather hard. I would probably go a little thicker than this because you can see some of my brushstrokes. But it's beautiful and I am excited to keep using it.
Really nice matte white, I bet it would look great on terra cotta or darker clay! I would definitely use 3 coats.
Really nice matte black, would definitely use at least 3 coats!

I have mixed feelings about these glazes as advertised. I tested them at cone 06 (witness cone was kissing the shelf), but I don't think 06 allows the glaze to mature enough for functional ware use ( 06 results would be cool for sculpture use though!). At low-fire, the results resemble under-fired glaze, not so much a true matte finish. Personally, I would not recommend this as a low fire glaze. However, I do think they are fantastic as a mid-range glazes! Both the black and white fired nice and glossy at cone 6! I was very pleased with the application and consistency of the glazes. 3 brushed coats provided a wonderful even coverage. I will use these at cone 6 :) Blick provided product for free to try and review.

ceramic_reviews.review_title: Perfect for Precision: Amaco Wax Resist Makes Glazing Clean
ceramic_reviews.review_desc: We used the Amaco Wax Resist (16 oz) in my high school ceramics class for a Teacher Appreciation Week project, where students hand-built personalized pencil holders for their teachers. It was the perfect tool to help them create clean designsthey applied it to areas they wanted to keep glaze-free, and it worked beautifully. The wax dried quickly and resisted the school-colored glazes exactly as expected, allowing crisp lines and clean finishes on each piece. It was especially helpful for keeping the bottoms of the holders glaze-free for kiln firing. Easy to use, classroom-friendly, and effectivethis wax resist made the glazing process smoother and more precise for all skill levels.

As a potter, and admitted "tool junkie" I have tried lots of ways to put glazes and underglazes on my pots, so often the spout gets clogged with thickened product, but this spout with a needle built right into the lid, keeps it clear and allows me to start work without first cleaning out the spout and if it gets clogged as I am working, a quick reinsertion of the needle/lid clears it for another round of line/dot application. weaving_reviews.review_title: Loving to learn to weave on my Cricket
weaving_reviews.review_desc: Being mostly a crocheter, I have no weaving experience prior to this 15" Cricket loom. I want to do dish towels so started with the 15" rather than the 10". My first project is a stash buster scarf following Angela Tong's online class. I'm really enjoying it and learning tons. Great loom!

weaving_reviews.review_title: I would order from this company again!
weaving_reviews.review_desc: This is my first rigid heddle (and my first order with Bick Art). I am a crafter and always wanted to learn weaving. This Cricket loom made it easy. I've already completed 3 projects and sold 2!!! Blick Art made ordering easy. The Cricket wasn't as expensive as I thought it would be (I've seen the 15" at much higher prices elsewhere). Shipping was fast (even if FedEx lost my package for a day). It arrived neatly and carefully packaged and I'm happy. Next I am going to order some easels for the grandkids!
Great and having fun using it
My Grandaughter was thrilled with the loom, and I was thrilled with the service...
Just for fun projects. The YouTube videos are very helpful. Couldn't get started with out them.

I have the 10 inch, and wanted a larger one (I also have a 24 in. Kromski). Super easy to use, warp and fits easily on the edge of a table because it has a deep groove. Tension stays tight. If you are buying one, I recommend this one over the 10 in for more weaving room.

weaving_reviews.review_title: The quality of this loom is exceptional.

weaving_reviews.review_desc: I'm really pleased with this inkle loom. I'm an absolute beginner to weaving and I found the Schacht videos online helpful and paper instructions included with this loom to be well written. I've made two bands so far and it's quickly becoming my favorite pastime for calming my nerves! The loom is sturdy and well made, and I'm very happy with my purchase.

weaving_reviews.review_title: Well designed and well built loom.

Its so easy to move the yarn on this loom when i need to move my work and the tension rod is easy to adjust and securely holds the tension. Love this and I'm so happy I got it from dick blick vs another online store.
I love this loom! I've made two bands on it now and can't wait to make more. The tension system is great and I appreciate the versatility of inkle looms.
This is a very well made loom. The pegs are fitted well and don't budge! The instruction booklet is clearly written; I was warped and weaving in no time! I've recommended this loom to fellow weavers.

Excellent loom! I use it for inkle, pick-up, and tablet weaving. The maximum warp is long enough to weave both a long dog leash plus the collar. It's sturdy and I expect to get lots of use out of it. I would definitely recommend it, and if I need to buy another, I'll buy it from Blick. It was the best deal I found, in stock and ready to go, with free shipping. Now I just need to convince Blick to carry all the colors of Maysville 8/4 cotton warp!

From the photo of this product, I assumed the warp would be vertical along the 6 inch line and not the 4 inch. So the resulting weave is short and odd. I recommend the makers do the notches along the 4 inch side so that the warp will be 6 inches. I do like the sturdiness of the cardboard. Thanks.
Really pleased with product exactly as described.

weaving_reviews.review_title: I would not buy this product again.
weaving_reviews.review_desc: We're sorry that the looms you received were not as expected. As pictured on our site, the 4" x 6" looms do have the warp notches on the 6" side; however, there should have been seven notches rather than four. We have checked our stock and can confirm that the product we're sending out will be as pictured, and of course we were happy to accommodate your return. We apologize for any inconvenience this issue may have caused.

I use these looms as part of an educational business I own. They are extremely solid and stand up to children's hands. I like that the notches are wide set. Fantastic product - I would be disappointed if Blicks stopped carrying them.

weaving_reviews.review_title: 15 Years of Creative Use for Loops!
weaving_reviews.review_desc: At Girls on the Run Vermont, we use this product as lap counters for all of our Girls on the Run and H&S teams. The participants are asked to set lap goals for the workout portion of the lesson/practice. A loop is given to each participant as they complete their lap. The loops are visual reminders/counters to be totaled at the end of the workout so their laps can be recorded. The participants find the loops very motivating. We love them, too, because they are reusable, colorful, affordable, and one bag usually supplies one team for the season. We generally have 120 teams :)!

weaving_reviews.review_title: Great loops at a very Fair price!
weaving_reviews.review_desc: Nice traditional loops for pot holders. Very fair pricing! The loops are not as nice as some on the market but they are just a fraction of the price and do make a nice pot holder, I call them Farm Style Traditional. Yes I will purchase again and I will recommend to my friends and family!

weaving_reviews.review_title: Also loops at a awesome price!

Yes I will purchase again and I will recommend to my friends and family!

Some of these loopers have a bit of a rustic look to them which I do not mind terribly. They look like they are tops & toes from socks & some have a bit of a second color on one side. They look just like the bags I used to buy as a child with my allowance. I sort the "odd loops" into bags & incorporate them in an intentional way, utilizing the 2-tone loops as part of my pattern.

weaving_reviews.review_title: At least I got some needed white loops

Bright colors and easy for kids to stretch to warp potholder loom.

We use the polyester loops as lap counters for Girls on the Run programs in our area. They are the perfect way to keep track of laps the girls are running in preparation for a 5K!

I am a believer in these cardboard looms for elementary students and you will be too. Long gone are the days of making my own out of cut up boxes! Stringing the warp can be difficult for some of my younger students but not insurmountable. I will be using these again and again.

These looms are quite sturdy, made of stout chipboard. I warp them with crochet cotton, and leave a little loop on the back when going from one slot to the next. I do this for two reasons; 1. It gives you the ability to loosen a warp thread if a student weaves with bulky materials that tighten the warp. 2. When weaving is finished, you can easily snip the loops to take the piece off the loom, and use the loom again. Before warping the first time, I go along and make sure all the slots are open all the way to the top; sometimes the sections between slots are attached right at the top, and this makes warping easier. I have students start by weaving two folded strips of paper in before they start their weaving, as spacers so when the warp is cut off the loom at the end, there are tails of warp that can be tied together to make fringe, or woven back up into the work to make a secure end. If you were to start weaving right at the end of the loom (which is what the picture here shows,) how would you remove it from the loom and secure the ends?
I love the size of the looms for making satchels. We weave half way down then take off and sew sides, add yarn to wear it around neck.

Love the size for my students, small enough to complete a satchel (we do half way down, takeoff then sew up sides). The only thing was the very end needs to be trimmed to use the notches. Looms can be used for more than once great value for the money!

weaving_reviews.review_title: Our art teacher thought they were wonderful quality!

It goes together really easily and, if necessary, is also easy to disassemble for storage. The wood is smooth enough to not snag my yarn but not so smooth that it slips and slides. The only thing I would like is for the pegs to be on 4 sides not just 3. It makes it a bit more challenging to map out my warping pattern and plan my cross; I was able to work out my path for the yarn but would appreciate the flexibility of having all 4 sides available for use. I found the best price here and am very happy with both the service and the product.

I love the quality of the construction and the simplicity of use. I am a beginner but I did a lot of research before purchasing, and this loom has the versatility I hoped for. The 25" width and the possibility to weave a tapestry up to 60" long was one attraction and it has a good tension adjustment system. I also didn't want to have to buy numerous after market parts so I like that one makes their own (reusable) string heddles giving great control over desired epi. Also the loom has the option of 4 sheds, adding more versatility should I want to experiment with other types of weaving. All in all I have been very happy with this purchase.

I cannot say how much I am enjoying weaving my tapestry on this loom. I told my husband that sometimes I feel almost guilty being able to have so much fun. I love it! Love it! Love it! When we have more room and more money, I'd love to purchase the Table Loom.

weaving_reviews.review_title: Excellent loom for beginning and even experienced weavers
weaving_reviews.review_desc: After falling out of the weaving habit for a really long time, I purchased this loom as an economical way of returning to the craft. About 15 years ago, I'd ordered a set of Schacht School Looms from Blick for an afterschool program for kids in grades K-12, and the looms held up remarkably well, even under daily and not always gentle use. Before purchasing one for myself, I checked out some other tapestry looms on the market, but kept coming back to the Schact. Craftsmanship is excellent, and it was really easy to assemble. Although users will be limited by the size, it's a spot-on piece of weaving equipment for making small tapestries, bags, and even pillows; larger projects will involve sewing the pieces together. As a textile design major with a specialization in weaving, I highly recommend this loom!
This loom is sturdy and just the right size to make a woven wall hanging. I've also made a handbag. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

I'm a first time weaver but have really wanted to get into it and couldn't have asked for a better/easier starter kit. The instructions packet was also very detailed which was nice.
Very easy way to learn to weave. Easy directions.

I started making my own tapestries by making looms from cardboard and decided I should upgrade to an actual loom. I am glad I picked this one because the size is perfect for my studio table. It's also light enough that I can carry it with me wherever I am going. It comes with two warping tools that I have found to work great. I think I might upgrade to the bigger Schact loom in the future.

I became obsessed with weaving only recently and couldn't wait to accumulate all the tools and materials necessary to start my own projects. I could have built my own loom, but I wanted it to be of high quality so I wouldn't be frustrated by working with a substandard loom that I made by hand. I looked around at looms of various constructions and sizes, and this Schacht School Loom fit the bill of what I most wanted. The price was very reasonable, my order from Blick arrived soon after I made the purchase, everything was just as described, assembly was very easy, and I was right on my way to weaving. I love working with the loom and look forward to it every day. The fact that it has legs that enable the loom to stand up on a surface means it's stable and not flopping around in your lap or on a table. It also feels like it could last a lifetime. I love it!

It had a little splinter in it that gets caught on the wool I'm using every time I use the stick to weave. Not too much of an issue since I'll just use some 320 grit sand paper and it looks like the stick will be just fine after that.

yarn_reviews.review_title: I would and have bought these blanket yarns repeatedly
yarn_reviews.review_desc: Bernat Baby Blanket yarn is wonderfully soft, chemical free, and everyone I've made a blanket for loves it. Two things to keep in mind: 1. Baby Blanket and regular blanket yarns are not exact matches of the same color. Baby Almond is lighter than regular Almond. The whites need to be carefully matched as they are all different by just a fine shadeVintage White, Vanilla, Blush, and White are not the same. 2. Save the specialty stitches for other thinner yarns. You can try them with this chunky yarn, but they won't show the way you think they will. So, enjoy these wonderful items, but try to make sure the colors go well together, and buy all that you need before you start! Have fun!

yarn_reviews.review_title: Works Great with My Addi Express!
yarn_reviews.review_desc: I knit double thick cuffed beanies for the unhoused neighbors in my community, using an Addi Express. Each beanie uses one skein. Wool-Ease is the only yarn I have ever used. My Addi works great with it. Tip: Every skein or two, rub down the machine with a cloth with a little squirt of food grade silicone spray on it to reduce static build-up that can cause split or dropped stitches. We like the 20% wool in the hope that it will help add some warmth when the weather is wet. The recipients really like their beanies. We wish that Blick would carry a chocolate brown, as the umber is too pale for our purposes. Our recipients currently like choosing among black, nightshade, forest heather, flint, and tawny port, and would love to have chocolate brown too. We are very grateful that you offer this yarn at such a good price, and hope you will continue to do so.
